list_definition.mean_english: sự giảm nhẹ; sự khuây khỏa
list_definition.definition: a lessening or stopping of pain, worry, boredom etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: When you have a headache, an aspirin can bring relief
He gave a sigh of relief
It was a great relief to find nothing had been stolen.

list_definition.definition: help (eg food) given to people in need of it

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: (also adjective) A relief fund has been set up to send supplies to the refugees.

list_definition.definition: a person who takes over some job or task from another person, usually after a given period of time

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The bus-driver was waiting for his relief

list_definition.definition: the act of freeing a town etc from siege
a way of carving etc in which the design is raised above the level of its background

list_ex_of_english: Effects such as those related to relief may be more evident on longer-term follow-up.
Only quick action would transfer people from relief to work as the president wanted.
In the other parts of the country the free poor relief funds dominated.
Initial criticisms were based on eyewitness records of the consequences of limited relief.
The balance between which measurements could be defined as prerequisites for the relief mission and which were additional science was difficult to achieve.
Significantly, the proportion of relief in kind did not diminish over the course of the eighteenth century.
We saw above that the number of elderly individuals who depended on poor relief increased over the course of the eighteenth century.
Most patients said that the engagement in the visual expression of a negative state of mind led naturally to a feeling of relief.
